page.title: 13Language Crosthwaite 'area'
page.content: {A Receet for Westmorland Rum Butter. Tek soft brown sugar,fower good ounce, A'nt same again o'butter,sum nutmeg an a glass o'rum,"by beat" a hearya mutter.Method:Yer butter down on't hearth ya put,I'fairsixed poddish basin.Mix weel we't sugar,screap yer nut,an'strinkle Lakeland fashion.Noo team yer rumin,quiet like,an stir again till setten.Keep taiastin ivery now and then,"Rum Butter" noo ye've gitten.{ {Transalation of Recipe:- Take four ounces of brown sugar,four ounces of butter,some nutmeg and a glass of rum.Warm the butter in a large bowl,mix in the sugar and beat well.Add the grated nutmeg and fold in the rum gently.Stir until setting. "Keep tasting every now and then, Rum Butter now you've got".
